Sentencas: Typical operating parameters of a SOFC-GT hybrid system have been established to study the influence of SOFC-cell design variables such as cell length, rib width, interconnect thickness, and operating variables such as degree of pre-reforming and air utilization, upon thermal cell management and economics.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Various SOFC production scales are being considered.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Fuel utilization, air utilization and operating voltage were held constant while the number of cells was adjusted to meet the utilization specifications.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Based upon the particular cell design and number of cells, the cost of the stacks has been established which is then converted to specific cost in $(2019)/kW(DC).
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Findings show that in co-flow SOFCs specific costs can be effectively reduced by maximizing the cell width/number of parallel channels without impacting current density and thermal cell management.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: The cost optimum for the cell length was found to be in the range of 15-20 cm.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: While overall temperature differences were reduced in shorter cells, local gradients were reduced in longer cells.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Increasing the rib width offers a cost-effective solution for reducing thermal gradients in the cell.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions

Sentencas: Air utilization reaches a cost optimum around 45% and the operating voltage shows that lower cell voltages increase overall temperature differences and local thermal gradients while reducing specific SOFC cost.
Titulo: Economics of cell design and thermal management in solid oxide fuel cells under SOFC-GT hybrid operating conditions
